actions.recommendation: After the age of 45 prostate screening is important. Some of the signs of prostate disease are poor erections, a weak urinary stream & having to wake up more often to urinate. Be on the look out for these as you grow older.

Losing weight, exercising, eliminating sugar, significantly reducing your alcohol consumption and managing your stress better will all contribute to helping you lose weight, lower your blood pressure and reduce your risk of chronic disease. Please monitor your BP and if it remains elevated then make an appointment with one of our doctors to address it. Blood pressure is thought of as the 'silent' killer and needs active monitoring.

Focus on your diet and lifestyle to lose weight and aim to reduce your waist circumference to below 94cms to reduce your risk of cardiovascular disease, high blood pressure and diabetes. Aim to lose at least 10% of your body weight.
Above optimal homocysteine. Raised GGT liver enzyme. Raised Blood Pressure.

After the age of 45 prostate screening is important. Some of the signs of prostate disease are poor erections, a weak urinary stream & having to wake up more often to urinate. Be on the look out for these as you grow older.
Blood pressure, cholesterol & insulin are of concern. We will monitor these every three months.
